author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਟੂਟੇ ਬੰਧਨ ਜਾਸੁ ਕੇ ਹੋਆ ਸਾਧੂ ਸੰਗੁ ॥

translation.text: One whose bonds are cut away joins the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy.

transliteration.text: tūtē bandhan jās kē hōā sādhū sang .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਜੋ ਰਾਤੇ ਰੰਗ ਏਕ ਕੈ ਨਾਨਕ ਗੂੜਾ ਰੰਗੁ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Those who are imbued with the Love of the One Lord, O Nanak, take on the deep and lasting color of His Love. ||1||

transliteration.text: jō rātē rang ēk kai nānak gūrā rang .1.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: RARRA: Dye this heart of yours in the color of the Lord's Love.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. text: ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਜਪਹੁ ਜਪੁ ਰਸਨਾ ॥

translation.text: Meditate on the Name of the Lord, Har, Har - chant it with your tongue.

transliteration.text: har har nām japah jap rasanā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਰੇ ਰੇ ਦਰਗਹ ਕਹੈ ਨ ਕੋਊ ॥

translation.text: In the Court of the Lord, no one shall speak harshly to you.

transliteration.text: rē rē daragah kahai n kōū .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: Everyone shall welcome you, saying, "Come, and sit down."

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: In that Mansion of the Lord's Presence, you shall find a home.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. translation.text: There is no birth or death, or destruction there.

text: ਮਸਤਕਿ ਕਰਮੁ ਲਿਖਿਓ ਧੁਰਿ ਜਾ ਕੈ ॥

translation.text: One who has such karma written on his forehead,

transliteration.text: masatak karam likhiō dhur jā kai .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. text: ਹਰਿ ਸੰਪੈ ਨਾਨਕ ਘਰਿ ਤਾ ਕੈ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: O Nanak, has the wealth of the Lord in his home. ||10||

transliteration.text: har sanpai nānak ghar tā kai .10.
